fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Energy, Environment, Taxation, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives: Priority for the moment are the !) Brexit and the implications for Ireland, 2)  climate/energy 2030 objectives. 3) The Energy Union. and 4) Agriculture. In addition regular reporting on developments in the domains of: Foreign affairs, environment, transport, Euro zone and research and technology.
organisation_name: The Institute of International and European Affairs, Brussels (IIEA Brussels)
section: IV - Think tanks, research and academic institutions
goals__remit:
IIEA Brussels is a politically neutral organization which will conduct the following activities:  
•    Provide its members with analysis and outlooks of the challenges on the global and EU policy agendas which impact on Ireland and on Irish interests in Europe.  
•    Disseminate the research and activities of the Institute in Dublin. 
•    Act as a listening post and advocate for activities of the Institute in Dublin. 
•    Provide a unique Irish forum in Brussels for networking. 
•    Organise events appropriate to its resources.  These may include: Breakfast briefings, Keynote Speeches; Roundtable Discussions; Dinners; Seminars; Luncheons; Panel Discussions; Gala Events; and Workshops.
